snippet: The crash of a Russian passenger jet that took off from Sharm el Sheikh has raised questions about the resort’s reputation as a haven from jihadist violence.
abstract: Russian plane that crashed after taking off at Sharm el Sheikh, popular resort in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula, raises questions about area's reputation as safe haven from jihadist violence; Egyptian arm of Islamic State has claimed responsibility for crash, suggesting possible security breach.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Cairo, and David D. Kirkpatrick from London. Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo, and Neil MacFarquhar and Nikolay Khalip from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The crash of a Russian passenger jet that took off from Sharm el Sheikh has raised questions about the resort’s reputation as a haven from jihadist violence.

headline.main: Sinai Plane Crash Threatens a Bright Spot for Egyptian Tourism
headline.print_headline: A Bright Spot for Egypt Is Threatened

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
